hevs.gdx2d.components.audio

Class SoundSample

  • java.lang.Object
    • hevs.gdx2d.components.audio.SoundSample

  • public class SoundSample
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to play short samples within gdx2d. The music sample must be short because it is completely loaded into memory. The counterpart is that you can play many many samples at the same time and modify their pitch and volume dynamically (see setPitch(float) and setVolume(float)).

    Note that SoundSample differs from MusicPlayer in the sense that a sample is completely loaded into memory before playing. Thus, it makes sense to play short samples but not complete songs (for background music for instance).

    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Pierre-Andr√© Mudry (mui), Nils Chatton (chn)

    • Method Detail

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float v)
        Changes volume of the song played
        Parameters:
        v - Should be between 0 and 1

      • setPitch

        public void setPitch(float p)
        Changes the speed (pitch) at which the sound is played. Valid values are between 0.5 (twice slower) and 2 (twice faster)
        Parameters:
        p - Speed (pitch) of the sound

      • modifyPitch

        public void modifyPitch(float newPitch,
               long id)
        Changes the pitch of a currently playing sound, specified by its id (which is returned by the play() method). If the sound is no longer playing, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        newPitch - See setPitch(float)
        id - See play()

      • mofidyPlayingVolument

        public void mofidyPlayingVolument(float newVolume,
                         long id)
        Changes the volume of a currently playing sound, specified by its id (which is returned by the play() method). If the sound is no longer playing, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        newVolume - See setVolume(float)
        id - See play()

      • play

        public long play()
        Starts playing the sample at the current pitch and volume. If it is already playing, another sample will start, concurrently.
        Returns:
        The id of the currently playing sample. Can be used to change pitch and volume while playing

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops playing the sample

      • loop

        public long loop()
        Plays the song in loop (repeat forever), using the current volume and pitch.
        Returns:
        The id of the currently playing sample. Can be used to change pitch and volume while playing

        Release resources when done working with them
